basicInfo.parentCompany: Independent (publicly traded on NYSE as NET; founded by Matthew Prince, Lee Holloway, and Michelle Zatlyn)
basicInfo.notes: Founded July 26, 2009 by Matthew Prince, Lee Holloway, and Michelle Zatlyn. Launched at TechCrunch Disrupt September 2010. IPO September 2019. Headquarters in San Francisco. Network spans 330+ cities in 125+ countries. Handles ~20% of global web traffic. Known for CDN, DDoS protection, Workers serverless platform, and Pages static site hosting.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Usage-based billing; No traditional refund policy

serverPerformance.ddosProtectionLevel: Enterprise-grade DDoS protection on all plans

support.prioritySupportCost: Included with Business ($200/mo+) and Enterprise plans

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unlimited bandwidth on CDN; Workers charged per request after included quota
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Usage-based pricing for R2, KV, D1
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; abuse; illegal content
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Excessive API calls; abuse of free tier; ToS violations
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Free tier is generous; Paid Workers starts $5/mo for 10M requests; R2 storage charges separate; No egress fees on R2; Pages static assets unlimited and free; Enterprise pricing requires sales contact

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: Strict content policy; Has terminated services for sites like Daily Stormer, 8chan; CSAM and terrorism content prohibited

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: Varies by program; Partner program available

editorial.knownIssues: Trustpilot rating low (2.0) due to end-user complaints about verification/captchas; No phone or live chat support for free users; November 2025 major outage affected many sites; Free tier users first to be deprioritized during load; Complex pricing for advanced features; Not traditional hosting - requires technical knowledge
editorial.bestFor: Developers building serverless applications; JAMstack/static sites via Pages; Sites needing global CDN and DDoS protection; Applications requiring edge computing; Cost-conscious users wanting free CDN/SSL; High-traffic sites needing unlimited bandwidth
editorial.avoidIf: Need traditional hosting with cPanel; Want managed WordPress; Need phone support; Non-technical users; Need traditional FTP access; Require dedicated server
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Largest edge network (330+ cities); Free tier extremely generous; Pages competes with Vercel/Netlify; Workers competes with AWS Lambda@Edge; R2 storage has zero egress fees (vs AWS S3); G2 4.5 excellent but Trustpilot 2.0 reflects end-user friction; Enterprise-grade security on free tier

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: World's largest edge network with 330+ cities, generous free tier, and zero egress fees on R2 storage
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Developer or business needing global edge performance, CDN, and serverless compute with generous free tier

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Cloudflare excels as a CDN, edge computing, and static site hosting platform with the world's largest network (330+ cities). G2 rating 4.5 reflects business satisfaction, though Trustpilot 2.0 reflects end-user complaints about verification captchas on protected sites.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Cloudflare is an independent publicly traded company (NYSE: NET) founded by Matthew Prince, Lee Holloway, and Michelle Zatlyn in 2009. Institutional investors own 82%+ of shares.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Cloudflare has a generous free tier including CDN, SSL, and basic DDoS protection. Workers Paid starts at $5/month for 10M requests. Pages static hosting is free. Business plans from $200/month.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Moderately. The dashboard is polished but Cloudflare is primarily for developers. No cPanel, no managed WordPress, and technical knowledge helps. Free tier is excellent for learning.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No email hosting, but Cloudflare Email Routing allows free email forwarding for custom domains.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Not directly. Cloudflare is a CDN and edge platform, not traditional WordPress hosting. It can front WordPress sites hosted elsewhere for caching and protection.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Cloudflare has a 100% uptime SLA for Enterprise plans. November 2025 saw a major 2-hour outage affecting many sites globally.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, usage-based billing with no long-term contracts. Free tier has no commitment. Paid plans can be cancelled anytime.
